title: sketch font!
content:
Anyone got any ideas on this one?

Cheers!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_316.png) | 32.81 KB |
author: jamiegrind

comments.content:
[WC ROUGHTRAD Bta, Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503/http:/www.abstractfonts.com/font/10906?text=carbon%20offsets) is in the ballpark.

[Sketch Block](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503/http:/www.dafont.com/sketch-block.font?nb_ppp=50&text=carbon+offsets) is a slab serif variation.

[Carbon Offsets](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503/http:/www.dafont.com/fff-tusj.font?nb_ppp=50&text=carbon+offsets) is a serif variation.

Thanks for the reply,  
Yeah I know of these fonts - but this particular one is almost like a rough version of Helvetica... any thoughts anyone?

<cite>this particular one is almost like a rough version of Helvetica</cite>

Actually that "t" isn't much Helvetica-like. But there's always Handvetica.  
 [http://www.dafont.com/handvetica.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503/http:/www.dafont.com/handvetica.font "http://www.dafont.com/handvetica.font")

Where do you found the sample?

I found it on this nice looking site:

[http://www.carbonica.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503/http:/www.carbonica.org/ "http://www.carbonica.org/")

Woah, even the buttons and icons are custom sketched on the site.

The site was created by [Creative Jar](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503/http:/www.creative-jar.com/portfolio/case-study/carbonica) and I'd imagine that the font is a custom aspect of their brand.

EDIT: I grabbed a SWF file off the site and took a closer look at how they were handing the sketched type. Below you'll see there are individual JPG for each letter.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/custom-letters_5464.jpg)
